format

Uses this class's conversion pattern to format logging messages
See Also:
format:
( NSString *) format:
        (L4LoggingEvent *) event;

Throws an L4InvalidSpecifierException if the pattern layout's conversion pattern contains an invalid conversion specifier.

Throws an L4NoConversionPatternException if the pattern layout's conversion pattern is nil. This should only happen if you have code like the following: 

			
				[patternLayout setConversionPattern: nil];


Throws an L4InvalidBraceClauseException when a conversion specifier's brace clause is invalid for any reason.

format:

Uses this class's conversion pattern to format logging messages
See Also:
format
( NSString *) format:
        (L4LoggingEvent *) event;

Throws an L4InvalidSpecifierException if the pattern layout's conversion pattern contains an invalid conversion specifier.

Throws an L4NoConversionPatternException if the pattern layout's conversion pattern is nil. This should only happen if you have code like the following: 

			
				[patternLayout setConversionPattern: nil];


Throws an L4InvalidBraceClauseException when a conversion specifier's brace clause is invalid for any reason.

Parameter Descriptions
event
A logging event that contains information that the layout needs to format the logging message
method result
A formatted logging message that adheres to the L4PatternLayout's conversion pattern

init

Initializes an L4PatternLayout with the default conversion pattern, %m%n 
( id ) init;

Calls initWthConversionPattern: with the string defined by L4PatternLayoutDefaultConversionPattern

method result
A newly initialized L4PatternLayout object

Parameter Descriptions
cp
The new conversion pattern

setConverterDelegate

Sets the optional converter delegate object for this pattern layout
See Also:
setConverterDelegate:
( void ) setConverterDelegate:
        (id ) cd;

When the pattern layout formats logging messages, it first takes the conversion pattern and parses it into token strings. Then, it takes each token string and converts it into the corresponding part of the final formatted message. You can provide a converter delegate to override or extend how a pattern layout converts its token strings. By default, the pattern layout does nothing to literal string tokens and converts format specifiers as explained in the description of this class.

The converter delegate must respond to the convertTokenString:withLoggingEvent:intoString: method.

setConverterDelegate:

Sets the optional converter delegate object for this pattern layout
See Also:
setConverterDelegate
( void ) setConverterDelegate:
        (id ) cd;

When the pattern layout formats logging messages, it first takes the conversion pattern and parses it into token strings. Then, it takes each token string and converts it into the corresponding part of the final formatted message. You can provide a converter delegate to override or extend how a pattern layout converts its token strings. By default, the pattern layout does nothing to literal string tokens and converts format specifiers as explained in the description of this class.

The converter delegate must respond to the convertTokenString:withLoggingEvent:intoString: method.

Parameter Descriptions
cd
The new converter delegate

setParserDelegate

Sets the optional parser delegate object for this pattern layout
See Also:
setParserDelegate:
( void ) setParserDelegate:
        (id ) pd;

When the pattern layout formats logging messages, it first takes the conversion pattern and parses it into token strings. You can provide a parser delegate to override how a pattern layout parses the conversion pattern into token strings. By default, the pattern layout divides the conversion pattern into a series of literal strings and format specifiers.

The parser delegate must respond to the parseConversionPattern:intoArray: method.

setParserDelegate:

Sets the optional parser delegate object for this pattern layout
See Also:
setParserDelegate
( void ) setParserDelegate:
        (id ) pd;

When the pattern layout formats logging messages, it first takes the conversion pattern and parses it into token strings. You can provide a parser delegate to override how a pattern layout parses the conversion pattern into token strings. By default, the pattern layout divides the conversion pattern into a series of literal strings and format specifiers.

The parser delegate must respond to the parseConversionPattern:intoArray: method.

Parameter Descriptions
pd
The new parser delegate
